name: Allen Chiu
whyClaid: I joined CLAID to make new friends!

name: Raymond lin
whyClaid: I wanted to learn more about Chinese culture and language, and the people here are super geniune and open

name: Alice Li
whyClaid: I really like hosting events and being able to meet new people!

name: Chelsea He-Chen
whyClaid: I joined CLAID because I love sharing Chinese culture and meeting new people!
hobbies: Tying knots, collecting stationery, watching kdramas, and walking in the rain

name: Cindy Chen
whyClaid: I really enjoy performing and CLAID gives me the opportunity to perform as well as choreograph sets with 100% freedom.
funFact: My boyfriend doesn't know I exist

name: Daniel Zhang
whyClaid: When my early work in filmmaking brought be close to my Chinese heritage, martial arts, and Asian performing arts, I found a loving community and shared passion for Chinese culture in CLAID.
hobbies: portrait illustration, painting, dance, videography, filmmaking
funFact: Lin-Manuel Miranda is one of my 100 Twitter (X) followers.

name: Xinyu Zhang
whyClaid: To make more good friends and learn Chinese Culture!
funFact: I'm allergic to cats but love to hold them

name: Megan Huang
whyClaid: I joined CLAID because I wanted to meet other people who share my love of Chinese culture. I also hope that through CLAID, I can deepen my own knowledge of Chinese culture.

name: Jonathan Wen
whyClaid: I joined CLAID because I liked the the sense of community and I wanted to improve my Chinese, especially speaking (it’s still not good but that’s my fault)
hobbies: In my free time I tend to exercise or watch anime
funFact: I am ordained so I can legally perform a marriage ceremony

name: Daniel Zhou
whyClaid: I got pied at an event, so I became a board member to assert dominance
funFact: I got promoted from intern to vice president in a year

name: Karen Xiong
whyClaid: I joined CLAID because I want to be able to learn more about Chinese culture and to connect with others in the Chinese community!
hobbies: I enjoy reading, traveling, dancing, and playing video games

name: Jiayan Wu
whyClaid: Amy asked me to lead fan and I did 030
hobbies: Dancing, baking, trying new foods, looking at cute shit

name: Elaine Wu
whyClaid: To meet people that are interested in Chinese culture and to promote it to more people

name: Qiwen Tan

name: Brandon Huang
whyClaid: I joined CLAID originally as a lead for Chinese Flags in the Performance Branch, and I've come to appreciate the community and the memories I've made so much!

funFact: I have a Spotify playlist with 2300+ songs!

name: Edward Chang
whyClaid: I love claid events especially the cooking and performance shows. I also really wanna help out with events this year.
